document_data.name: Church of Savras
document_data.base: The [[House of the All-Seeing Orb]], the [[Hall of Pools and Mirrors]]
document_data.mainbody: The '''Church of Savras''' was a collection of [[cleric]]s, [[monk]]s, [[diviner]]s and [[specialty priest]]s called [[sibylite]]s who were devoted to [[Savras]], the All-Seeing One.
document_data.Organization: The Church of Savras was relatively small as few in [[Faerûn]] knew of Savras or held him in poor regard. Savras' clergy was collectively referred to as the divinators. The majority of his clergy was composed of sibylites. Novices were referred to as Truth Seekers. Other titles used in ascending order were Truth Speaker, Savant, Scholar, Sage, Clairvoyant, Soothsayer, Prophesier, Prophet, and Oracle. The highest ranking members of the clergy had unique titles.
document_data.Activities: All divinators spent a great deal of time meditating in order to gain glimpses of the future.
document_data.Celebrations: The [[Vision (event)|Vision]] was celebrated annually during the [[Feast of the Moon]].
document_data.Base of Operations: Savras' largest house of worship was the [[House of the All-Seeing Orb]] located in [[Tashluta]]. He also maintained a hidden shrine, called the [[Hall of Pools and Mirrors]], deep within [[Candlekeep]].
document_data.Orders: The [[Sibylline Sisterhood]] was an organization of prophetic women who wandered [[west Faerûn]] providing prophesies for donations.
